SEARCH
Package name.martingeisse.grumpyjson

Class JsonRegistry

java.lang.Object
name.martingeisse.grumpyjson.JsonRegistry
public final class JsonRegistry extends Object
This registry keeps the JsonTypeAdapters used by a JsonEngine.

  • Constructor Details

    • JsonRegistry

      public JsonRegistry()
      Constructor

  • Method Details

    • clearTypeAdapters

      public void clearTypeAdapters()
      Removes all type adapters from this registry. This is useful because the registry that is used by a newly created JsonEngine contains default adapters, and the code using it might not want to use them.

    • addTypeAdapter

      public void addTypeAdapter(JsonTypeAdapter<?> adapter)
      Adds a type adapter to this registry, to be used when parsing and generating JSON with the JsonEngine that uses this registry.
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter to add

    • supportsType

      public boolean supportsType(Type type)
      Checks whether the specified type is supported by any adapter in this registry.

      Note that there are some reasons why an adapter may claim to support a type, but fail at run-time when it actually encounters that type. Such a type will still be "supported" by that adapter from the point-of-view of the registry. Refer to the documentation of the individual type adapters for details.

      Parameters:
      type - the type to check
      Returns:
      true if supported, false if not

    • supportsAdapterAutoGeneration

      public boolean supportsAdapterAutoGeneration(Type type)
      Checks whether a type is supported by this registry through auto-generation, that is, without ever registering an explicit adapter for that type. If this method returns true for a type, so does supportsType. Note that this method even returns true for a type for which a type adapter could be auto-generated but a type adapter has already been added manually, so the auto-generation never actually occurs.
      Parameters:
      type - the type to check
      Returns:
      true if supported through auto-generation, false if not supported or only supported through an explicitly added type adapter

    • getTypeAdapter

      public <T> JsonTypeAdapter<T> getTypeAdapter(Class<T> clazz)
      This is a convenience wrapper for getTypeAdapter(Type) in case the type is a raw class object. It returns the adapter as a typed adapter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the adapted type as a static type
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class to return an adapter for
      Returns:
      the type adapter

    • getTypeAdapter

      public <T> JsonTypeAdapter<T> getTypeAdapter(com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken<T> typeToken)
      This is a convenience wrapper for getTypeAdapter(Type) in case the type is a not raw class object but can be specified statically using a type token. It returns the adapter as a typed adapter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the adapted type as a static type
      Parameters:
      typeToken - a type token for the type to return an adapter for
      Returns:
      the type adapter

    • getTypeAdapter

      public JsonTypeAdapter<?> getTypeAdapter(Type type)
      Returns a type adapter for the specified type, auto-generating it if necessary and possible. This method will throw an exception if no adapter for that type was registered and no adapter can be auto-generated. If multiple type adapters have been registered that can handle the specified type, the one registered earlier will take precedence.
      Parameters:
      type - the type to return an adapter for
      Returns:
      the type adapter
